Test Description: Testing ability to optimize moves or scoring for a given game state and trying to have a grounded rule application
Difficulty Notes: Easy optimization problem with intuitive solution
Question: What is the largest field (in terms of tiles) can be formed by adding one more tile to the current landscape? Provide your answer in the format: [Tile = <chosen tile>, size = <number of tiles in the largest field>]
Rationale: The current large fields are having: central field (16 tiles), rightmost field (10 tiles) and left most field (5 fields). In order to increase the field length, with the given options, is to connect them in a way it would increase the filed length. Taking option A, any ways would increase only one tile. Tile B could be placed in empty square below the top left corner that would get the right most and left most fields as one giving: 10 + 5 + 1 = 16 fields. Any other orientation would only increase any other area by only 1. Taking tile C, if added in the bottom left corner would give 5 more fields to the central field. The total number of fields would be 16 (from central) + 5 (from right field) + 1 (from the tile itself) = 22 tiles.
